marcgg # books
→ blog → photos → hire me
This section lists blog posts that are part of a series of book reviews and are meant as a way to quickly share my opinion on what I've been reading. They are not to be taken as general analysis of the books. If you generally enjoy my blog posts, you might share my opinion on most of them.
"The Pragmatic Programmer" by A. Hunt & D. Thomas

From 'crash early' to its general pragmatic approach, I find myself quoting from this book all the time. It really is a reference for any modern programmers and a must read. → Get this book.

"The Clean Coder" by Robert C. Martin

This book gets into what it means to be a programmer. It dives into everything ranging from ethics, to commitment to craftsmanship and is a great read for any experienced developer. → Get this book.

"Work Rules!" by Laszlo Bock

Google's approach to human ressources, which I'd recommend reading for anyone interested in the recruitment process and willing to scan through a few pages glorifying Google. → Get this book.
